p: The majority of DRDs among PLHCV occurred among those with a history of injecting drug use (95.4%). Similarly, a majority of HCV-negative individuals individuals dying of a DRD had a history of injection drug use (85.6%) ( Tables 1 and 2 ). The population of PLHCV dying of DRDs was also older (born prior to 1965: 52.0% vs. 27.9%), more likely to have co-infections such as HIV (13.6% vs. 1.6%), and HBV (10.5% vs. 1.1%), to have a record of OAT (54.9% vs. 26.0%), and be more materially (most deprived quintile: 36.8% vs. 27.9%) and socially (most deprived quintile: 55.9% vs. 39.2%) deprived compared to the HCV-negative individuals ( Table 2). More than half of PLHCV and HCV-negative groups had a major mental illness diagnosis and more than 20% in each group reported a diagnosis of psychosis.
